posts.content:
Hello Everyone

I'm delighted to say I've got the club a stand at The Silverstone Classic. For those of you who aren't too sure what this event is, it's a big one! A classic car show with literally thousands of classic cars all over Silverstone, some of the best historic racing that rivals Goodwood, a shopping village in the infield of Silverstone and music gigs in the evenings on the Friday and Saturday.

Last year Rikki saw Soul II Soul and we saw UB40. So below is going to be some photos of last year's event and a YouTube link with the TV coverage, but the biggie is, that we could join one of the classic car convoys and do a lap of Silverstone.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=17Y1msRYYFs

All we're doing at this moment, is gauging an interest and numbers. From that we can then hopefully organise club camping etc. My recommendation for the weekend would be to rock up Friday and leave early doors Monday morning after rush hour.

So who's interested?

Hi Sam
Put me down I’d love this, looks like a great weekend.
Are you sure they want a load of old slow vans kicking about?
Cheers John.

Please put me down too !


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Can you add my name please


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Can you put me on the list please?
Well done Sam, looks like a brilliant weekend. I'm sure we can leave the kids and the dogs behind . Any idea what the prices are like?

Sounds good, count me in.

Sent from my SM-G960F using Tapatalk
We would be interested in this sounds great. Thanks for organising

INFORMATION REGARDING BOOKING, PRICES, ETC

The link to purchase tickets is: www.silverstoneclassic.com/buycarclubtickets

You will be asked for a dedicated car club code. It is: CCD00822019 Please note they are zeros and not the letter "O". There is a super early bird offer if you book before 31 December. After that there is a normal early bird until the end of March 2019 and from then on, you'll be paying full price. Super early bird for a 3 day weekend is £99 which is for admission for 2 and entry to the infield. Please note that this does not include camping at the Woodlands Campsite. I will be looking into this tomorrow and will let you know how I get on.

Question, what if people want to go, that don't have a Split? Is this camping Split only?

Cheers

Hi Jim

Camping is for everyone in anything. The discount code is Split only and admission to the circuit only. Camping is at the Woodlands Campsite next to Silverstone. This is the closest campsite to the circuit and the campsite is for the general public. So in short, your mates and family can book as per the public and camp no problem but that code is for Split Screen bus only admission to the circuit, not camping.

Also as a completely separate issue, I would love to buy one of your hazard light kits when I meet you there.

Cheers pal

Sam

Booked
1x super early bird Club ticket at £99.00
2x camping adult tickets at £98
1x standard electrical hook up £70.00
Transaction fee (barstewards) £1.95
Total £268.95
Less than half compared to Goodwood. Plus there'll be music too.
Heads up lovely people the early bird ends 31st March. Please have a look at the website to see what this event is all about. All races confirmed and the music is too. Hope to see you there.
